text.head: Tega Cay
text.p: Tega Cay is a small city along the eastern shore of Lake Wylie west of the town of Fort Mill in the Olde English District of South Carolina. Tega Cay is a suburb of the major city of Charlotte and has experienced rapid growth over the past decade.
text.head: Understand
text.p: Tega Cay means "beautiful peninsula" in Polynesian and has been known for its professional golf courses, restaurants and beachfront parks located on the Tega Cay peninsula of Lake Wylie in South Carolina.
text.head: Get in
text.p: Tega Cay is accessible from Interstate-485 exit number 4 and Interstate-77 exit number 88.
text.head: Get around
text.p: Tega Cay is best accessed by car, but cycling is common through the town especially in residential areas of the greater peninsula.

text.head: Sleep
text.p: There are no hotel accommodations in the city of Tega Cay, but there are a few options in nearby Fort Mill.
